website_summaries.verdict: Simple design and quick set up make this one of our favorites. If set up speed is a high priority, this is the travel potty for you.
pros: Wider, deeper seat than some models, yet without adding bulk when folded down
It's quick and easy to set up to prevent accidents
Doubles as a potty seat, making it versatile for home or travel
cons: May slide forward on the toilet seat when used as a potty seat

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for potty training.
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever. For potty training this really is essential. Now we can leave the house and not worry. Toddler says "pee!" and we can accommodate. Useful in a public bathroom, parking lot, side of the road, etc. Best features: The plastic bag covers the entire seat, so this thing always stays clean. Plus it has a travel bag. Tip: after using it, prep a new bag for it before putting it back in the travel bag. Then when you need it, it's all ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: TimTheEnchanter

customer_reviews.title: BIG improvement over the potette!
customer_reviews.text: We used the potette with our first two kids and I loved it, except how hard it was to click the legs into and out of the standing position. When I saw the video for this travel potty, it looked like it would be much easier to set up and it is! I love that I'm not having to grab ahold of the bottom of the leg that has touched the floor in a public bathroom in order to close the legs. With this one, you just push a little button and the legs easily close.
customer_reviews.author: *sallyp*

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful for using on the go, in the car. We were waiting in the car for my husband to get coffee, and my newly potty trained son announces he has to pee. I ask him if he can wait until we get home. He says "Nope!" I whip out this potty and ask if he would pee on this. He says "Yes!" I set it up, and sure enough he peed in it! You can use the bags they sell for this potty, and you can easily attach your own grocery store plastic bag. So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Mom Life

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping in the car
customer_reviews.text: This is our car potty, I keep it in a bin in our trunk of an SUV, great if there are no suitable public bathrooms to use. Also, when we visit friends or family, my young toddler can still use this and feel comfortable on a big toilet at their house. It came with three plastic bags and a heavier carrier bag with a drawstring. The carrier bag is pretty cheap. I use a fabric bag I have with a package of bleach wipes
customer_reviews.author: Raven the MavenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Opening is too small
customer_reviews.text: The opening isn’t big enough for my 32lb, 36” son. It might be fine for a girl if that size but for us the pee just goes all over the front of the seat instead of into the toilet! Also, it requires two steps to open it for use on a toilet seat - it opens with the legs pointing down easily but then you have to press the buttons on the back of the seat as you flip the legs out to the side. When you’re in a hurry (as you likely will be when potty training a toddler) it is not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: NKB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome to travel with
customer_reviews.text: Awesome to travel with. I bring this on picnic days for my training tot. I love that it came with bags with the little padding to soak up the pee. It's perfect. I'm sure when I run out I'll just use a grocery bag with towel paper, but I never would've had the idea if I hadn't seen these first. It's got a carry bag which is nice. It's small enough to fit in a pack and light enough to clip on the the outside of a pack so you have options.
customer_reviews.author: KittyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, toddler LOVES it, perfect for on the go!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently using this with the Potette Plus Reusable Liner. I bring both folded up in my backpack everywhere I go for my newly potty-trained son who greatly resists the "big potty" (i.e. adult toilet). We've used this at the park, or in a public bathroom...when he is done I dump or bag the contents (with a biodegradable bag, which I later empty in the toilet). Soooo easy to use, reduces waste from using plastic bags, and my 3-year-old toddler is happy to use it!! I will also add that the "flip legs" design is convenient and sturdy - it's great quality and should last for multiple potty-training seasons!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Friedman

customer_reviews.title: This potty is a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This has made potty training on the go so easy! It allows us to feel comfortable still going on adventures and not worry about a bathroom near. Especially with coronavirus, I have no interest in going in public restrooms. It is small enough it fits in the backpack. They bag it came with were really nice but there were only 3. I have just been using 2 Safeway bags and it works fine. For pee I just let him pee with no bag onto the ground or in the car put plastic tub underneath. My son is doing so well at potty training and we can still go on adventures to beach and parks with no worries.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Anne

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE for toddlers!!
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver! Our 2 year old boy potty trained in a weekend and I can’t tell you how much this helped with our outings. We’ve used it so many times freestanding and even more times in public bathrooms to put on top so he doesn't fall in. The pee guard is also tall enough so that the stream doesn’t come out. It also fits nicely in my backpack with the carry bag. A MUST HAVE! I recommended these to all of mommy friends that potty train! A tip with public bathrooms though is to place it in the middle instead of the front especially with a boy, it helps with balance and that pee stream doesn’t go everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: N. H. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great potty seat cover
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding potty. I can either open it flat against and sit it right on top of a public toilet seat. Or (if the bathrrom is exceptionally gross) I open it open into a seated position and place right on the seat so that he can rest his feet on the seat and his hands don’t touch any part of the toilet. At the park, I don’t even bother with a bag. and it fits great in my diaper bag!
customer_reviews.author: msdependable

customer_reviews.title: Does it all
customer_reviews.text: This portable toddler toiler does it all. It converts from a toddler toilet cover to a free standing toddler toilet. I brought this on our trip to Disney World and used it every day. My little guy had no trouble at all going whether it was in our resort bathroom or in the amusement park bathroom. I haven't had to use it free standing (yet) but it's so easy and quick setting it up I know in a pinch I will have no issues. Cleaning is also no issue. Using disinfectant wipes is one, two, three!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Jr

customer_reviews.title: Well designed
customer_reviews.text: We use this potty all the time and find that it is convenient and well-designed. You can even use the legs to have it stand up on a toilet seat in public restrooms so the toddler's legs aren't hanging right over the toilet bowl. My only complaint is the bags are expensive and overly thick/large. It just feels like a lot of wasted plastic for a tiny bit of toddler pee. Also, the potty is not so good for the beach... we got sand in the hinge and one of the legs doesn't fold well now. But it's still quite a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne83

customer_reviews.title: Extremely handy!
customer_reviews.text: I recently potty trained my son and a friend suggested I purchase a little potty for “on the go” so I decided to purchase this one because you can use with regular toilet too. Wow! This little potty has came in handy so many times! With times being crazy right now I don’t feel comfortable taking my 2 year old into any public restroom, and this has been so handy! Just pull over and let him use it. Easy to use, put away, and clean. Only downside is that it only comes with 3-4 bags so I recommend buying some of the bags separately!
customer_reviews.author: Haydee

customer_reviews.title: You have to get this
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for potty training and if you travel a lot with your LO. Even when it’s just a trip to the mall. Kills my back when she needs to go to the potty and I have to lift her up and then squat to hold her on those yucky public toilets, yes sorry to say even the women’s bathroom is just as bad as the men’s. (coz she’s still too tiny and might fall in otherwise). This with a portable foldable potty I can just find a spot in the bathroom, and lay paper towels in the floor, and she can sit on it by herself.
customer_reviews.author: Z3333ds

customer_reviews.title: Travel potty
customer_reviews.text: This worked well on the toilet seat as it is stable and doesn't shift like some potty seats. Once our little one got used to going, we didn't really need the special seat anymore, but it did make her feel safe until then. It folds flat to about 1-2 inches wide. It wasn't designed to have a removable, washable bowl, but the 1.4L Rubbermaid Take Along Round container fits fairly well as a toilet bowl. It came with some disposable bags to place under the seat, but I've never used them.
customer_reviews.author: Maria J

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and comfortable for little kids who are potty training
customer_reviews.text: When my older daughter was little we got the Potette one or whatever it is called. She refused to use it. So, with my younger daughter, I wanted to try something different. She uses it just fine. The size is perfect: it is big enough to be comfortable and small enough that it’s easy to take places. We bought it for our vacation, and it was perfect. The way that it holds bags is nice. At first I had trouble understanding how to fold it up, but once I realized you just need to push the two buttons, I was grateful that it is so sturdy when it is open.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kerby

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I debated this for awhile but finally ordered when my daughter was potty trained at home but I was scared to leave the house diaper free. I'm so glad I ordered this! The quality is great, it folds flat and is light weight, and it fits in my diaper bag without making it bulky. I love that the legs open flat to put on top of regular toilet because my daughter has a tiny butt and this helps her feel secure. Has rubber on back of legs to keep it from sliding while on toilet. Love it! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MelindaS

customer_reviews.title: Decent portable potty
customer_reviews.text: This is a good portable potty but I slightly prefer the pottete plus I believe it's called because it is smaller making it more travel friendly and it seems to be more sturdy when put on a toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene B.

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve with little boys (literally!)
customer_reviews.text: This is an essential for potty training. We haven’t used it as a stand-alone but as a travel toilet seat when we’re out and about with our 2-year-old son. It’s super compact and a lot less intimidating for our kid to use than a big potty. For parents of boys, know that the shield of the potty is hollow. If the boy sits too far back on the seat, the pee curves under and shoots upward from the shield and out, showering his pants/undies with urine. We’ve had many “accidents” from this potty even though we made it in time and have had to change his pants. You need to really help him sit properly to avoid an outfit change.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great for minimalists! Coveres ALL bases for potty training.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has made potty training SO much easier. At first we had her little pink potty in the trunk of our SUC when we went places but then we’d worry about it tipping over while we drove home, now after she goes in the bag we can put it in the trash or tie up the bag and throw it away at home. I love how you can use it on a potty or as a potty. I have 4 types of potty seats, but this is perfect for minimalists. It good for home and traveling and good as a potty or to place on the potty. If I ordered it first, I wouldn’t need the others.
customer_reviews.author: King Kong

customer_reviews.title: Love my OXO portable potty!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this portable potty! I’m a germaphobe and hated the idea of potty training my son to include public restrooms. Now, I don’t have to put him on the nasty public toilets! This works great. The only negative is the price of the refills. They are more expensive than a lower cost competitor, so I tried the lower cost option and they work great with this portable potty, so I don’t buy the OXO refills. Both have the absorbent pad in the base of a great quality plastic bag. One is round and one is square, but they both do the job!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: opening too small, unstable
customer_reviews.text: The opening is too small, my 1.5 year old little boy barely fits on it. Also it is unstable and shifts back and forth on most potties, and there is a gap between the seat and actual toilet that allows for pee to get through....watch out you need to plug it with toilet paper!! Would return if I had the time....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly potty
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this product. It’s a great travel size and fits easily in my daughters skip hop backpack with a few changes of underwear and pants. However, when positioned on the toilet, it seems to wobble which freaks out my daughter. Now I’m spending time trying to convince her that she’s not gonna fall off the toilet. When used on its own it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: SuzW10

customer_reviews.title: Great potty! Easy to fold!
customer_reviews.text: This potty is great for travel and outdoor use! I wish there was a bucket instead of having to use a bag every time. That would make it more useful as a floor potty. It does fit on the big potty very well! You can use it without bags and just a big potty seat. My son was so excited to sit one it. I have a few pictures of him trying to sit on it but backwards haha
customer_reviews.author: Sarah DeLaurier

customer_reviews.title: Potty Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: Agonized over potty training because we commute almost an hour to work/daycare every day. What to do if she has to go potty in the middle of nowhere? This was the answer!!! Perfect, quick, convenient. In my smallish mid size car I push the driver seat forward & she can go potty on the floor of the back seat. In public restrooms they say you can use it as a toilet seat topper. I find it easier to just put paper towels on the floor of the restroom & use this as a potty instead = zero contact with icky public toilet. I use this potty w/ grocery bags & 4-5 sheets of Bounty paper towels for absorption.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Peach

customer_reviews.title: 1 for every bag!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Having 2 girls who decide when we are heading out/ are in public to have 150000000000 bathroom breaks, this potty is a life saver. Picnic in the middle of Prospect Park check, glamping close to Austin check, the never ending small shops in Barcelona check(you get the idea). Using it as a standalone or as a "booster" on the toilet bowls works for me perfectly well as my girls are different ages. Any mom of girls needs to have several in case you forget one or drop it into a kid festival party Porta potty,ijs. 1000 % ROI just knowing that a dirty toilet seat won't be a problem anymore.
customer_reviews.author: erika k

customer_reviews.title: Where has this potty been all my kids' lives
customer_reviews.text: This potty is amazing. So easy to fold and carry in a bag or backpack. Easy to grab and setup. Much easier, less embarrassing to carry literally everywhere than a regular Fisher Price training potty. This potty can accommodate regular store grocery bags (suggest doubling them) but the refill bags are worth the security of not having leaks. Pros-Easy to use, on the go potty. You basically have a bathroom everywhere you go. Can be used by bigger kids. Cons-Carrying around a bag of urine (or more) in a public place.
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING, MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: Ok... I thought this product was super stupid and unnecessary at first... BUT we LOVE it and have used it more times than I can count. We did the "Oh Crap" Potty training method and so I just brought this little potty with me in the diaper bag whenever we were out and about. My daughter does great with it and it's low to the ground so it puts their knees in a better position for pooping. The bags it comes with are nice but generic 4 gal bags with a piece of toliet paper on the bottom works perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: SnazzyTopazzy

customer_reviews.title: So great for potty training success while on the go.
customer_reviews.text: This potty chair has made outings while potty training so easy! I love that it comes with a bag to keep the potty separate from other items in your diaper bag and it also makes going potty in public easier because you don’t have to bring your whole diaper bag to the potty if you are out to eat for example. I also love that it doubles as a chair that can stand up on its own. This has saved me in so many situations!! The bags that it comes with do a great job of containing pee. This seat doesn’t slide around at all when my daughter is on it. I would not want to potty train without this!!
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: The best travel potty!
customer_reviews.text: We recently potty trained our son and bought this for when we’re out, especially since we don’t want to use public restrooms right now due to safety concerns. This travel potty is amazing! It’s so convenient to just throw the bags away and it’s very small when folded up, so it’s easy to store it in the car. The bags are a bit pricey, but we have felt it’s worth it, especially with the little absorbent pad inside of them. Overall this is a great buy and I’ve already recommended it to several friends!
customer_reviews.author: WeLoveOllie

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool, but not functional
customer_reviews.text: The seat is designed for portability, but falls short on functionality. The seat is too small for my 2.5 year old boy, so it doesn’t have enough of an opening to allow his pee stream to hit inside the toilet seat. Makes a mess every time unless you aim down his penis straight down to the toilet. The seat also rocks back and forth when you place it on top of a full sized toilet seat. It’s also too short for it to be realistically used as a portable toilet.
customer_reviews.author: S.K.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! Small, sturdy, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this potty. It’s small for travel, but big enough for my daughter to sit comfortably. It’s not heavy so when I have to throw it in the backpack for a hike, I don’t mind. It can be set up anywhere and the feet keep it stable - which is key when you have a little one trying to balance. I’m usually frugal, but the bags that come with this are worth it so that you’re confident nothing is escaping the bag! I also keep a pack of pocket tissues in the bag for wiping.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for Traveling with Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I got this because we were potty training our 2 year old son and we have a 4 year old. It's absolutely perfect for the car! It's small and folds flat. It comes in a nice little bag for storage. Whenever the kids have to potty, I can have the potty and the bag ready in a few minutes. Disposal is simple and mess free. You just pop the bag off, tie, and discard! We leave it in the car and use it for short trips and long trips! No more nasty convenience store bathrooms!!
customer_reviews.author: Lezlee

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit!
customer_reviews.text: This does not fit a modern regular oval toilet seat. It’s like really small and round? Who has a toilet that old??? What a waste of money. I was told the baby Bjorne one is the best so I’ll order that one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!!
customer_reviews.text: This mini on-the-go potty is the best! We potty trained our toddler a couple weeks ago and this has already saved us so many times. We took a road trip a week after potty training and this really came in handy when he needed to go but we weren’t near a public restroom. The bag system keeps everything contained and the potty itself clean as they never actually come into contact with it. It folds totally flat for storage so it easily can be thrown in the back of your car, stroller basket, etc. This thing is sturdy and I can’t recommend it enough!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is already potty trained, but with the COVID pandemic, we didn't want to stop in a public restroom for bathroom breaks and risk exposure. We purchased this potty, and it worked perfectly. It comes with several bags to use as liners, but it also works with other bags you may have around the house (i.e. you don't need to buy special bags for this)! We also took this down to the beach so we didn't have to run home every time the little guy needed to go to the bathroom. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Back Up For the Car
customer_reviews.text: We take a lot of camping/road trips and I keep this in my car for our daughter. She was 5 the last time we used it and it was great to have. We pulled over and set it up very quickly. Then we tossed the bag in the trash. Setup and clean up is incredibly easy. I definitely recommend this for anyone with kids. I always feel better about traveling with this in our trunk. Especially in a Covid Era when I don't want them going into public places and touching things.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Foster

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable when in it's on-toilet configuration
customer_reviews.text: It seems like it will work well as a standalone alone potty. We'd hoped to use it as a toilet topper as well, but it sits really close to the middle of the toilet, so their legs have to go straight, rather than hanging. That didn't work for my daughter. She felt out of control and scared. After reading comments online, we switched to the owl portable seat, and she LOVES it. We are keeping this one for a stand alone travel seat...we just use that function so much less frequently that we haven't even tried it yet (vs 50 or so on-toilet portable potty needs so far)
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Not great for little boys
customer_reviews.text: While this product is a wonderful seat, easy to clean, fits perfectly in the diaper bag, and great for easing my son's nerves about the big potty, it's also not so great for little boys. The pee guard on it is too little, and we can't sit him back far enough that he doesn't make a mess. He gets upset when he makes a mess, and the pee gets on his leg. The pee either goes right over the pee guard and all over the floor, or it hits the pee gaurd and splashes up and over, all over him and the regular toilet seat. If you have a little boy, consider a different seat or be prepared for messes.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: Must have potty for on the go!
customer_reviews.text: So amazing!!! We can't live without this portable potty!!! It's perfect for when on the go. We keep it in the car and whenever there is an emergency urge to potty... its very easy to pull out and let her go. I can fit it on the floor in my backseat for privacy. It's also so much cleaner than using many public restrooms! We also take these on hikes and when we go on trips! The best thing is it can also sit on top of a toilet with no bag needed.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMommy

customer_reviews.title: A must have for potty training.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a lifesaver. So easy to transport in its little bag, fits in our diaper bag, and converts to use with normal toilets. We’ve been potty training for two weeks and so far we’ve used this at the park, the playground, the doctor’s office, and the grandparents’ house. I ordered biodegradable grocery bags at the recommendation of another reviewer and those work well—if your little one pees a ton in one setting you might want to put a pad at the bottom of the bag for absorbency. You could also just collect and reuse normal grocery bags. Overall a clutch purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: A must have for potty training!
customer_reviews.text: This potty is super light weight and being able to just throw my daughter's waste away makes it the easiest way to potty train. We fold out up and put it in the diaper bag. It doesn't get shipper small, but it's still better than lugging around a regular sized training potty. You can buy the bag refills, but we just use grocery bags because here in California they are super thick. When we're home, we put it directly on the toilet so there's nothing to throw away. My daughter picks it up and puts it on the toilet when she wants to go potty. It's that easy! Definitely a must have for any parent's potty training adventure.
customer_reviews.author: June Bug

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious game changer. Potty training is already stressful. Finding where all the restrooms are while running errands is exhausting. Enter the OXO 2-in-1 potty... No ‘public’ restroom? No worries this gem ready and waiting. In the middle of no where? Throne-to-go is here to help! Anywhere you want to be it’s there with you and the scramble and panic of finding a toilet is no longer something i/you will have to worry about. If you’re potty training, you feel my pain and I feel yours. Buy this. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: DRACC

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my niece's three year old who is training.
customer_reviews.text: She loves it (both the baby and the mom!). They have it in the car in case of an emergency stop lol. When they finished using it the first day, the three year old insisted on taking it into the house so she can potty! Well, my niece found it so handy as their little girl is now all trained after two weeks! They purchased another for the car trips as well so as not to have to use a public restroom in this day of corona etc. Very pleased overall with this purchase. Glad I could help the process along! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Madalene G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product- not always a great fit
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful idea for a product, but be ware that it does not fit all toilet seats. We purchased it to be sent to a location we were traveling to, and it fit great on all the seats there! We were so pleased with our purchase! However, on the way home, we had a few seats it did not fit (probably more that it didn’t fit than ones that it did). Also, it doesn’t fit on our toilet seats at home. Overall- great quality, great idea, great product! Just be ware that it may not fit what you are hoping it does. I would still buy this product again, especially for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi S.

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE for potty training and beyond
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect during the potty training stage and still is great now that she's two. Potty training started early for us, and she was afraid of public bathrooms (heck, I'm not a fan of them either). This was perfect to have in the SUV so that she could go without having to worry about the noisiness of a public bathroom. She just turned two a few months ago and is completely potty trained and we still use this when we travel. It's compact, easy to clean, and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: S. James

customer_reviews.title: Thought I would never use this but I was wrong!!!
customer_reviews.text: When my wife bought this, I was like why did you spend money on this?! Needless to say I have since retracted that statement. We were stuck in construction traffic and my son who was potty training at the time had to go number 2. We weren't moving and there was no where to go except in this potty. It was a life saver!! We have used it a few other times while driving and have used it camping as well. It is a bit awkward to use in a car but we made it work.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: awesome, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: this thing is awesome to have if you have toddlers who are potty training or are already trained. when you're driving, perhaps get stuck in traffic, or even just don't want to use disgusting bathrooms at the mall, having this thing is awesome. i bring this with me on walks/hikes (it's super light and folds up to easily fit in my stroller), and it's been awesome. any parent of a toddler knows that when nature calls, you have precious little time to respond before an accident, and so this thing has been great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this product.
customer_reviews.text: If you are shopping for a travel potty, just get this. We keep this in the car and it has come in handy so many times. It stores easily in a sturdy plastic bag it comes with along with the bags that go with it. Our kids use it in the car at playgrounds where the bathrooms are sketch and whenever it’s urgent. Getting them to pee before leaving the house can be a pain sometimes, and I don’t always push it knowing we have this in the car. Definitely get the bags designed for it. They fit well and have the absorbent pad inside. We have used grocery bags before in a pinch tho.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great way to avoid gas station bathrooms on road trips!
customer_reviews.text: I use 2 layers of grocery bags and a disposable absorbent diaper liner pad (can use a diaper, paper towels, or whatever you have on hand) inside the bags to line the potty. I put a pack of baby wipes in the carrying bag with it. After our 3 year old uses it, I toss the used baby wipes inside and just tie up the outer grocery bag and throw it in the trash. Nothing ever touches the travel potty since it’s lined with grocery bags, so everything stays perfectly clean! And I don’t have to take my child inside a nasty gas station bathroom on road trips!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Wise

customer_reviews.title: My newest must-have
customer_reviews.text: I rolled my eyes when my mom told me I needed a travel potty for the car. But I bought one "just in case" before we left for vacation. Do you know how many times this has come in handy? A LOT. The park when the bathrooms were locked, the soccer field where there was only a porta-potty, etc. It's sturdy and comfortable for my 3 year old and I like the ability to easily tie up the bag and throw away the contents. It folds flat and sets up in seconds. (Because we all know little ones give you so much notice when they have to go...)
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: In order to let my children go out during potty training (just in case the public lavatory can not be found). This 2-in-1 OXO Tot has good stability and size suitable for kids. Every time it's timely. Especially when we going out during the COVID-19, the kids don't need to used public lavatory at all, thus avoiding the chance of contact with viruses or other germs. Of course, you always need to clean your hands as well after going to the potty, no matter when.
customer_reviews.author: Eillen

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend for boys
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son for potty training and I wouldn’t recommend it for boys. It doesn’t have a splash guard or handles to hold while they sit and the seat doesn’t have enough of a seal with the toilet to prevent pee from coming out from under the seat. I purchased a different seat that worked much better for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this potty
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say how much I love having this potty. We call it our “car potty”. We have a 2.5 yro boy. Potty training was difficult. We don’t have a lot of notice when he needs to go and public toilets are often yucky. We keep this potty in the car and use it regularly when we are out and about, and especially on road trips. It folds up super compact. Recently, we went to a carnival where there were only portable toilets. I was able to put this potty into our diaper bag and just pull it out when we needed it. Sooo much cleaner than a portable toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: A life saver when on the road with a toddler but not great as a potty seat
customer_reviews.text: This travel potty seat is overall a very good product, and can really make the difference when traveling with a toddler. Pros: - nice design - lightweight - sturdy, large and comfortable seat but small enough to fit in a small backpack - works with any plastic bag (no need to buy the expensive refills, just use the supermarket vegetable plastic bags) - easy to fold and open, locks in place well Cons: - when used as a potty seat on the regular toilet, it has no adapters so it is not as stable and tends to tilt back and forth when the kid is sitting on it
customer_reviews.author: BojanUliev

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for long car rides!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 16 hour car ride. I have a 6 yo boy & 4 yo girl. Both wait till the last minute to go to the bathroom. This was small enough that my son used it in the floor of our back seat (we were on I-20 & there was no more waiting for him)! Once at our destination we used it on the toilet seat & it worked just as well! We did buy the bags & they are awesome. They have a little patch of absorbent stuff in there so once they have gone it soaks up some! Very handy! Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jamey

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Perfect for in the car for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It’s a life saver, for car travel. (Which we mainly use it for) it’s small and takes up barely no space.. we loved the actual bags that come with the potty, but we have run out and now use two shopping bags and some paper towel to line it and soak up the liquid... that works good until we purchase more of the actual bags. I love how the legs pop out so you can use it on public potty’s. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen V

customer_reviews.title: This potty seat is a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: It never fails that my 4yo has to potty while we’re in the car & I’m not a fan of taking her in a gas station or store just to go, especially during a pandemic, so I keep it in the car. It fits perfectly in the floorboard of my SUV & sedan, and is very stable so no worries about it collapsing while in use. I also take it on long walks in our wagon or stroller. I put extra potty bags & wipes in the storage bag for extra convenience. I definitely recommend using the OXO bags made for the seat, they have an absorbent pad & are great quality so I’m not worried about tearing! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kwhite

customer_reviews.title: Great travel potty.
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It's such an easy set up. My daughter took to it immediately. We keep it in the car and she does her business so easily. The bags are a little pricey and I've been told to just use shopping bags, but since shopping bags are +10¢ Or more, I just bite the bullet and buy the oxo brand (ebay is the cheapest). Plus, the oxo bags have a potty pad inside to soak up excess liquid for easier cleanup. Back to the potty, I like that it Congress with a travel bag. Makes for transport super easy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chen

customer_reviews.title: A potty training must have!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! We’re potty training our 18 month old and love that I don’t have to I can go out and not interrupt her potty training when we’re out shopping, eating or at someone else’s house. Also gives me peace of mind that she’s not sitting directly on a public toilet and I use a disinfecting wipe after every use. It comes with a bag with straps for travel but I bought a regular backpack to carry it along with the bags and wipes. I highly recommend! Oh and the bags are VERY absorbent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t car travel without it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver for a looooong camping trip this summer. We traveled over 4,000 miles camping along the way. When the bathrooms were limited or were close, we just popped this out in the back vestibule of our tent or pulled the front seat forward and set it up in the back floorboard for a quick pooping potty. When we ran out of the included bags, we just used plastic grocery sacks with a feminine pad in the bottom to absorb any pee. It was quick, traveled well (small enough to store under the passenger seat), and was a very easy, fast clean up. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RShaw

customer_reviews.title: Secret weapon!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband actually came across this product when he was at a park with our 3 year old who suddenly needed to “go” and then found that the public bathrooms were out of order and closed! A mom who was nearby and heard their predicament whipped this product out of the bottom of her stroller and let my daughter use it! (How kind is that?!) It prevented an accident and my husband came home raving about it and insisted we order one right away to keep in our car for potty emergencies. Thank you to the Good Samaritan mom at the park!
customer_reviews.author: GabbyFraser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent away from home potty or toddler toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: I take this seat all over with my granddaughter. It is versatile and can be used on toilets or as a stand alone emergency potty with a disposable bag. No need to be washing a little potty if there is an emergency in a car. Just dispose of the bag. It is very strong and sturdy and a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Annette P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to keep in the car
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 2-year-old to use during a road trip because she was still potty training and it worked great! We whipped it out so fast at a random gas station parking lot and she went with no issues. We even brought it out on the boat to use. I like that I didn't have to take her inside any gas stations (because, COVID) and will be keeping it in my car for good as a just-in-case potty. Folds easily, small footprint, highly recommend. BTW I use regular plastic grocery bags instead of buying specific ones from OXO and they worked just fine (though I recommend making sure there aren't any holes in the bags first!).
customer_reviews.author: Lauren G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for potty training
customer_reviews.text: The design works great as a stand alone potty or on the toilet. It is perfect for potty training. We use it with a Potette Plus Collapsible Reusable Liner. Our toddler is new to potty training and is both uncomfortable going potty in new places and doesn’t like the normal public toilets. I can set this up in a stall to use and she feels comfortable since it’s familiar. It folds up nicely into its bag and fits easily in my diaper bag.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good option for travel
customer_reviews.text: Pros- Easy to set-up, easy to clean, very portable Cons- splash guard isn’t a “comfortable” height- my son has to sit exactly right on it or there is a huge mess, it sits very low to the ground and the bag sticks to the skin when using as a stand alone unit (though this can’t really be avoided, I suppose) Overall, it works for an on-the-go potty, but I much prefer our baby Bjorn potty for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Popular playground potty!
customer_reviews.text: We were past potty training phase but my nanny asked that we get this so she didn’t have to keep coming home from the playgrounds to go potty. My 2.5 daughter uses it since she can’t just stand by a tree. That said, my son used it the first day too! We bought this brand because it was recommended by the other caregivers on the playground as the most effective. Also great that it works with a normal grocery bag!
customer_reviews.author: Sully823

customer_reviews.title: Best travel potty seat!
customer_reviews.text: This seat helped us so much, my son was scared of public restrooms and once i got this seat i got him excited about it and told him it was his “outside potty” since getting this seat he started using the public restrooms, i didn’t put it on the toilet at first used it on the floor with the refillable bags which are also sturdy and boom he now sits on public restrooms thanks to this. It’s also perfect to keep in the car when no restrooms are available near by. The only negative thing i have to say is that it’s a hassle to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up and very convenient! I have twin toddlers and not having to make 2 back to back trips to the public restroom is so much help. We can be at the park or beach n just have them go in this potty. The bags absorbs very well. I will be buying those instead of just a regular plastic bag because sometimes it has holes n leaks everywhere (trust me, it happened to me). Definitely recommend for all those lil ones.
customer_reviews.author: ChinaMGD

customer_reviews.title: It works and it’s super handy!
customer_reviews.text: It’s in my truck otherwise I’d show a picture. I got this because we’re potty training my youngest and my oldest loves to wait till we’re 3 minutes from the house to announce he needs to potty. It comes with bags, which was a nice surprise, although I did buy a pack of 30 anyway. It’s already come in handy so many times. I’ve tested it out myself, it’s not super sturdy for adults but it holds! If you’re a mom, you understand the chore of being alone with your kids and not wanting to drag everyone to bathroom. I wish I would have jumped on the travel potty bandwagon years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Essential for potty training
customer_reviews.text: This changed the game for my toddler potty training. She was FULLY trained within a week of using this. Perfect for on the go. Great in light of the current situation where restrooms are closed. We use strictly in the car but can be used on standard toilet. Easy to fold and store. Lightweight and portable. Holds plastic potty covers securely with flexible flaps on both sides. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: P. Darby

customer_reviews.title: Better safe than sorry
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my 4 year old daughter, for when we are on the road. I dislike her using public restrooms. I love the fact that it came in it’s own individual bag and that it can be used standing anywhere or put over a toilet seat, however, I dislike the fact that the legs are too short that my daughter is unable to pee comfortably (she weighs 30 lbs) and the seat seems as if it can break with her weight. Overall, the pros outweigh the cons.
customer_reviews.author: Yessi

customer_reviews.title: A must have for traveling with kids!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this potty. We bought it to keep in our suv for traveling. It’s been a godsend when one of our young kids needs to use the potty urgently while we are away. I keep it in the bag with extra grocery bags to catch waste. So convenient that it can be used as a potty seat on a toilet or as a free standing potty. Easy to clean too. We love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Christa L

customer_reviews.title: You need this
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a life saver. Best money I ever spent. My daughter loves her little potty. It's compact and light enough to shove into my little backpack for her and carry around. So much cleaner than using a public bathroom. Saved us from many accidents when we weren't near a bathroom or there was a line. I just pop it open, throw a bag in there, and she's done in 10 seconds. the oxo bags are great but you can use any bags. I keep mine in the car. You need one of these if you're potty training and want to leave your house.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old is basically potty trained but sometimes we are out and about without a bathroom nearby. We purchased this for those emergency situations - esp with the pandemic and our avoidance of going into strange/dirty public bathrooms. We also used this on a 8-hour car ride. It’s compact and easy to use. Just make sure to buy/bring bags!!
customer_reviews.author: Sahkira

customer_reviews.title: You must buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest invention ever in the history of potty training! So easy to use, fits in a backpack and can go anywhere. No dumping the pot and having to clean out (or carry with pee residue!) Just remember those poop bags for when one happens (we did not use the bags it came with bc it took too much time to put on - when a kids gotta go, they gotta go!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great potty seat!
customer_reviews.text: Love this potty seat! I leave one in each car for my potty training son. It’s sturdy, and bigger than the other seat on the market. I have both and definitely use this one more. The other is a little smaller, but this one feels more secure. Love the lil bag it came in. I keep extra bags, wipes, and a toilet cover in the bag. Great potty seat!
customer_reviews.author: Aliha Talton

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Light. Small.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second. We decided we wanted one in each car so we didn’t have to keep remembering to move it. Fits in a diaper bag, backpack, large purse. Lies flat comes with its own plastic storage bag. Can pop legs down to use as a free standing potty or flip the legs out and use on top of a standard toilet as a seat cover making the hole to the toilet smaller. I carry plastic bags to use in public spaces like parks where I can double bag over the toilet then throw away their waste.
customer_reviews.author: rk

customer_reviews.title: Seat rocked when using it
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product because it rocked when my son sat on it (you fold the legs in when using it on a toilet-created a gap byw toilet and training seat). Of course when he discovered it rocked he would not stop. This became a safety issue for me. I liked the high front shield for my boy who tends to overshoot. It’s not super portable since the seat does not fold.
customer_reviews.author: JTS

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver for on-the-go travel potty. We take this everywhere with us in our backpack for times when our 3 year old can't wait and it's been easy to use and easy clean up. Just pre-load the bag onto the potty seat, pop open the legs, and it's ready to be used like a sit down potty. It's low to the ground but it does what you need it to do. We use it with the recommended OXO bags that have the absorbent pad in them but I think any leak proof bag (size of "grocery store" plastic bag) would work.
customer_reviews.author: MVMama14

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was bigger
customer_reviews.text: Really like the folding mechanism, it's very practical especially to carry inside the car for those unexpected emergencies and for travel also. I like that it comes with a bag so you can easily carry it without being obvious that you have a potty, the bags are genius! It has a napkin kind of thingy inside that makes the pee like gelating, well most of it, so I would recommend to buy extra bags. The only but that I have is that the opening is very narrow, my 3 and 4 year olds barely fit in the potty it does the purpose but It really is small, I guess for emergencies only it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: Catalina

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing! I have ordered one for my car and my husbands! They fold up small and the bags fold over the seat keeping it clean. If you want you can spread the legs out flat and use it on a regular toilet seat, but I have yet to do that. It fits great in the bottom of my stroller and has come in handy numerous times on the side of the road while potty training. I love that I can set it up in the back of my SUV and that there is no mess. The liners are expensive, but well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Folds to easily fit in a standard backpack
customer_reviews.text: This thing has changed our lives, seriously. I used to get so anxious about toileting our daughter while out and about and now it's just no big deal. This thing fits over adult toilets and has legs that fold down to mimic a traditional toddler potty. Folds to easily fit in a standard backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Potentially can minimize trips to public restrooms when pair with a minivan
customer_reviews.text: Whoever invented this should be elected to the Inventor’s Hall of Fame. Pair this potty with a minivan and you have a mobile potty solution for the terrible twos! We have substituted the expensive white bags, which are unnecessarily thick and expensive, with cheap Costco’s own Kirkland wastebasket clear plastic liners (10 gallon). Cost savings are over 97% by using said plastic liners. We keep rolls of toilet paper in the minivan at all times so we just tear up some squares and lay them down on the bottom so as to help prevent pee from splashing up. Never had issues with leaks so there is no cleaning up to do. We now look forward to taking long trips.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Kinetic

customer_reviews.title: Great for the car
customer_reviews.text: Can’t recommend it enough. Perfect for traveling with a toddler. My 3 year old needs to pee every 5 minutes so this comes in super handy. The disposable bags make it easy to clean up, they also have an absorbent liner so they don’t get splash back since it’s pretty low to the ground and not too deep. I wouldn’t use it at home since the bags would be wasteful but it’s great to keep in the trunk. Folds down, doesn’t take up too much space.
customer_reviews.author: CRo

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: My son uses the big potty but I have this in the corner of my living room when we're home and it is great for those times when he knows he won't make it. We've used it in the car a couple of times and in public restrooms. I've actually bought 2 of these and I would recommend them to everyone. It's sturdy, lightweight, small enough for the diaper bag and is so easy to clean. I wish it was just a bit taller but it serves its purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy VanAlstine

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling...just keep it near the back of the toilet!
customer_reviews.text: We picked this one up as a travel seat, but we also use it at home. It's lightweight and super easy to use. We are potty training a boy, so the one thing to keep in mind is that you want it as far back on the seat as it'll go - otherwise you'll be in the splash zone. But still, a great option for travel or taking with you.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K

customer_reviews.title: Fits easily in diaper bag
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a LIFESAVER! Small enough to put in our diaper bag and so easy to keep in the back in our suv. My daughter refuses to go potty in public toilets since most of them flush on her. Lol and the bags with the puppy pad things in the bottom are genius. Just throw them away when done! LOVE THIS PRODUCT! 10 stars!
customer_reviews.author: gameplayer

customer_reviews.title: This potty saved my vacation!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 year old who is terrified of public toilets. Automatic flushes are the sounds her nightmares are made of and with a trip to Disney coming up I was desperate. I thought I’ll try this what do I have to lose! IT WAS A GAME CHANGER!! This potty completely took away the horror of holding my wriggling terrified 2 year old over a filthy toilet that is spraying “water” as it automatically flushes with every move we make. I love this potty. It would give this potty 10 stars if I could. And the disposable bags are perfection! I don’t know who invented this but they should be up for sainthood.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!  Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for on the go potty pit stops! I keep this set up in the back of my minivan for when we arrive and are about to leave public places. So convenient. I am so glad I purchased this before I even started potty training-it relieved a lot of my potty training stress. Just buy it! Also works great as a home potty in the big toilet.
customer_reviews.author: jerseyjazz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel, but a bit short.
customer_reviews.text: Great for traveling, we used it for camping! Also used when needing to pull off on the side of the road and my daughter wanted to sit, not squat. Downside, it thought it would be a little taller. My daughter looked uncomfortable at times, mostly for #2, trying to sit on the short potty. Otherwise, the concept and the ease was great!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Combs

customer_reviews.title: Its great as a freestanding potty while using the bag but ...
customer_reviews.text: This potty is just ok. Its great as a freestanding potty while using the bag but it is not really secure on a toilet itself wether its an oval or round seat.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Marie King

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect! We use it for traveling as well as when we stay at grandparents houses who don’t have a small potty. It also fits great in the bag they provide and then I put that inside the diaper bag. I used it at the library today - cleaned after each use and it was perfect! It also comes with little bags for outside.
customer_reviews.author: K6789

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done right, just not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and sleek potty. Love the flexibility of the product. However I do not like that my toddler moves around on this when she's on the toilet. For lack of a better word, she teeters on it. Like being on a chair that has a shorter leg than the others. The splash gaurd also does NOT help me avoid cleaning pee off my toilet, but great try.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel potty
customer_reviews.text: Literally perfect. This goes everywhere with us! I use a planetwise lite bag to store it in when out and about. At home it is in the corner of my living room, with a planetwise trash bag and prefold inside to catch his #1&2. Fits on toilets well, and small enough to fit in the diaper bag. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son. I was right in the middle of potty training and had to take a long car trip. 4 day car trip. This was a wonderful blessed useful thing to purchase by far!!! It came in handy for my other kiddo who is potty trained and didn’t have a bathroom near by! So very useful and easy to use! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Barry Williams

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I've been carrying this on my trunk for a full year. I sit my 3 year old on it before we go in the stores and after. It works well also, since we always travel and we get off the freeway and no need to go on a wild goose chase searching for a restroom. We just sit his lil butt down anywhere anytime and we are all happy! We even carried it in our trip to Mexico where there was no access to a restroom in excursions. I recommend this to any parent that wants nothing more than convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Camping!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for camping for my 3 year old son to use. It's easy to pack into our gear, lightweight, easy to fold and unfold, and sturdy for a toddler's weight. This was a lifesaver for our summer camping trips. No need to trek to the bathroom all day or in the middle of the night. The xoxo bags that fit the seat are also quality and held up well. I would definitely recommend and buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa K.

customer_reviews.title: Great car potty
customer_reviews.text: We keep this potty seat in the car along with the liners for emergency potty breaks on the road when there is no restroom nearby. We have used it a couple of times in the car. Liners have an absorbent tissue that turns liquid into gel. This potty can also be used on a toilet seat, just fold the legs out and it becomes a potty ring.
customer_reviews.author: riasupermomma

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I have made in awhile!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have told everyone I work with about this toilet seat! It is so easy to use and so handy, I had to buy two for both cars. My three year old has been using this for awhile and it is a great alternative to public restrooms and portable potties while out a fair. Great for potty training when you need a potty quick. The bags are great and don’t leak. It’s nice to just tie the bag close and throw it out, no mess!
customer_reviews.author: katlin
